DOC.brief_summary: Background: Activation of NO-synthase and vascular potassium (K) channels may play a role in the sepsis-induced attenuated sensitivity to norepinephrine. We examined whether various K channel blockers and NO-synthase inhibition could restore norepinephrine sensitivity during experimental human endotoxemia.
DOC.brief_title: Blockade of Vascular Potassium Channels During Human Endotoxemia
DOC.criteria: healthy volunteers drug, alcohol, nicotine abuse
